title: What Lives in This Hole?
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 217 words, Level H (Grade 1), Lexile 450L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in level                     K		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     K and N
description: From the deserts of Arizona to the streams and rivers of Japan, people have wondered What Lives in This Hole? Join the student author as he writes a class blog about burrowing animals from all over the world. Interesting photos and detailed maps give readers the opportunity to learn about animals they many never see above the ground. The book and lesson are also available at Levels K and N.
reviewWords: burrows, naked mole rats, puffins, salamander, tunnels, wombat
comprehension: Main Idea and Details                : Identify main idea and details
awareness: Long Vowel Sounds                : Identify and discriminate long vowel /o/ sound
grammar: Exclamation Marks                : Recognize and use exclamation marks
wordWork: Suffixes : Identify and understand the use of suffix -ing
